node.title: 'No transparency' on DHBs' contractor spending
node.description: Researchers have found big holes and major discrepancies in records of how almost half a billion dollars is spent propping up the country's public health system.

node.title: Residential special school enrolment changes possible
node.description: The Green Party has blown the whistle on secret talks aimed at boosting enrolments to the country's three residential special schools.

node.title: Isolated East Coast communities rally together as Covid-19 cases rise
node.description: The small isolated communities along Tairāwhiti's East Coast say they are putting in the hard mahi as Covid-19 cases rise.

node.title: Short of breath, in pain, vomiting blood: What it was like getting Covid-19
node.description: Nearly half a million New Zealanders have now officially had Covid-19. Health correspondent Rowan Quinn talks to a pregnant nurse, a parent and an immunocompromised student about their experiences.

node.title: 'It doesn't make any sense': Epidemiologist pushes back on vaccine mandates
node.description: The clamour to ditch vaccine passes and change the traffic light setting is poorly timed, an epidemiologist says. Audio

node.title: Efforts to boost NZ digital workforce to fill demand
node.description: NZTech says the push is on to put more people into digital jobs, as a means to building economic growth and helping businesses scale up to size with a New Zealand-base workforce.

node.title: Reporting from a war zone: The NZers on the ground in Ukraine
node.description: The Detail - Newshub's Europe correspondent Lisette Reymer and cameraman Dan Pannett have witnessed some of the horrors of Russia's invasion of Ukraine first hand.

node.title: GCSB records 15% rise in cyber threat incidents in 2021
node.description: The GCSB is urging the country's critical businesses to stay alert in the face of increasing cyber threats.

node.title: 'No resource, no support and no consultation' - GP says primary care struggling in Omicron outbreak
node.description: An experienced Northland GP who hung up her stethoscope last week is hitting out at health bosses over the way primary care workers are treated. Audio

node.title: Health officials apologise after elderly woman's 23-hour wait at hospital
node.description: Health officials have issued an apology after a Palmerston North woman in her 80s waited almost a day in the city hospital's overcrowded emergency department until she was moved to a ward.

node.title: 4 shot in downtown Austin during final weekend of SXSW festival
node.description: Austin police said​ Sunday afternoon that a suspect was in custody.

node.title: White Ferns lose another World Cup thriller
node.description: England have all but knocked New Zealand out of the Womens Cricket World Cup after beating them by one wicket at Eden Park.

node.title: GOP backing an aggressive policy toward Ukraine, breaking with Trump
node.description: Few Republicans are echoing Trump's description of the Russian president​ as savvy or smart.

node.title: 'It's a system failing' - report exposes crisis in literacy
node.description: Nearly one in five 15-year-olds are not meeting the lowest benchmark for reading, and a further 20 percent are only achieving at the most basic level.

node.title: 'Behaviour is unacceptable': Police seek offenders after milk tanker damaged
node.description: An investigation has been launched into the smashing of a milk tanker's windscreen and milk being tipped onto a road at the weekend.

node.title: Significant need for growth in water and wastewater treatment sector - report
node.description: New Zealand's water sector must do more to attract a pipeline of talent in order to meet safe drinking water and improved environmental standards, a new report says.

node.title: Unvaccinated New Zealanders quietly allowed to skip MIQ
node.description: A law expert says the government's move to allow unvaccinated New Zealanders to skip MIQ show the rules are changing with the country's evolving Omicron outbreak.

node.title: Foreign Minister promises more sanctions on Russia
node.description: Foreign Minister Nanaia Mahuta has promised more sanctions on Russia with officials working now to identify Russian interests in New Zealand. Audio

node.title: McConnell says "vast majority" of Republicans "totally behind" Ukraine
node.description: GOP Rep. Madison Cawthorn of North Carolina was filmed telling supporters that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is a "thug."

node.title: Transcript: Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell that aired Sunday, March 20, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Heavy rain warning into evening as storm moves across North Island
node.description: North Island residents are being warned to take care on the roads today, with heavy rain and thunderstorms forecast and the possibility of tornadoes.

node.title: Transcript: Ukrainian Ambassador Oksana Markarova on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Ukrainian Ambassador to the U.S. Oksana Markarova that aired Sunday, March 20, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Unvaccinated US man planning trip to NZ with illegally-obtained certificate
node.description: An unvaccinated man plans on travelling to New Zealand - and there's no way to tell he hasn't had the jab.

node.title: Moana Pasifika suffer heavy home defeat
node.description: Moana Pasifika have been convincingly beaten by the Chiefs 59-12 in their Super Rugby Pacific match at Mt Smart Stadium.

node.title: Super Rugby stumbles while Six Nations shines
node.description: Analysis - With the Six Nations tournament coming to a climactic end, the benchmark for test rugby now belongs in the Northern Hemisphere, writes Jamie Wall. Video

node.title: Tom Walsh back in the medals at indoor World Championships
node.description: Tom Walsh claims a fourth successive shot put World Athletics Indoor Championship podium finish.

node.title: England prevail over New Zealand in a thriller
node.description: England have knocked New Zealand out of the Womens Cricket World Cup after beating them by 1 wicket at Eden Park.

node.title: Transcript: Dr. Scott Gottlieb on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Dr. Scott Gottlieb that aired Sunday, March 20, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Transcript: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin that aired Sunday, March 20, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Austin vows "significant reaction" if Russia uses chemical, biological weapons
node.description: "This is a very serious step and as you heard our president say, we won't take that lightly," Austin said.
